wikipedia_page.main: Ruth S. Aylett (born 1951) is a British author, computer scientist, professor, poet, and political activist. She is a professor of computer science at Heriot-Watt University in Edinburgh, where she specialises in affective computing, social computing, software agents, and human–robot interaction.

response: *Ruth Aylett (born 1951), Professor of Computer Science at Heriot-Watt University in Edinburgh, Scotland

Jones was born in Sheffield, South Yorkshire, England and grew up in Stockport, Greater Manchester, and briefly in Falkirk, Scotland. His father, Rob Jones, was a local authority worker and trade union shop steward, and his mother, Ruth Aylett, is a professor of computer science (initially at the University of Salford and currently Heriot-Watt University). Jones says his paternal grandparents were from North Wales and his father first learned English at the age of six.
